5. General AlgebraÂ¶

In PyCox we apply the term general algebra quite liberally. This typically means algebraic constructs which are not encapsulated by the theory of Coxeter groups (for example permutations and polynomials).

Warning

The implementation of the general algebra concepts are not robust. Very few checks are performed so that they are efficient for the task at hand. This means they are easily broken!

The following concepts are defined and used throughout PyCox.

  • Permutations
    • Cycles
    • Induced Permutations
    • Miscellaneous

Type \(\mathrm{A}_n\)
